intro: Seseli rivinianum, commonly known as Rivianum seseli, is a flowering plant native to the Balkan Peninsula. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and umbel-shaped inflorescences. The plant typically grows in rocky or limestone soils and is often found in mountainous regions. Its flowers are usually white or pale blue, and it blooms during the late spring to early summer. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species in some areas.
